title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 22 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 22.

questions.question: What did David say the place was in 1 Chronicles 22:1?
options: The house of the LORD God and the altar of burnt offering for Israel
A place for sacrifices to Baal
questions.correctAnswer: The house of the LORD God and the altar of burnt offering for Israel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:1 states that David said, 'This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.'

questions.question: Who did David command to be gathered together to help build the house of God?
options: The strangers that were in the land of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The strangers that were in the land of Israel
questions.explanation: According to 1 Chronicles 22:2, David commanded to gather together the strangers in the land of Israel to help build the house of God.

questions.question: What materials did David prepare in abundance as mentioned in 1 Chronicles 22:3?
options: Iron for nails and brass without weight
questions.correctAnswer: Iron for nails and brass without weight
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:3 says David prepared iron in abundance for nails and brass in abundance without weight.

questions.question: From whom did David receive much cedar wood for building?
options: The Zidonians and they of Tyre
questions.correctAnswer: The Zidonians and they of Tyre
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:4 states that the Zidonians and the people of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.

questions.question: Why did David say Solomon was suited to build the house of the LORD?
options: Because Solomon was young and tender and the house must be magnifical
Because Solomon was a mighty warrior
Because Solomon was already a priest
questions.correctAnswer: Because Solomon was young and tender and the house must be magnifical
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 22:5, David explains Solomon is young and tender, and the house to be built must be exceeding magnifical, so he prepared for it.

questions.question: What command did David give Solomon regarding the house of the LORD?
options: To build a house for the LORD God of Israel
To build a palace for himself
questions.correctAnswer: To build a house for the LORD God of Israel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:6 records David charging Solomon to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.

questions.question: Why was David not allowed to build the house of the LORD himself?
options: Because he had shed much blood and made great wars
Because he was not a priest
questions.correctAnswer: Because he had shed much blood and made great wars
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:8 explains the LORD said David could not build the house because he had shed much blood and made great wars.

questions.question: What is the name of the son who will build the house of the LORD and bring peace?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:9 declares that Solomon is the son who will build the house and bring peace and quietness to Israel.

questions.question: What did David ask the LORD to give Solomon in 1 Chronicles 22:12?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom and understanding
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 22:12, David prays that the LORD would give Solomon wisdom and understanding to keep the law.

questions.question: True or False: David prepared timber and stone abundantly for the house of the LORD before his death.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:14 states David prepared timber and stone abundantly for the house before his death.

questions.question: True or False: David commanded the princes of Israel to oppose Solomon in building the house of the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:17-18 shows David commanded the princes to help Solomon, not oppose him.

questions.question: True or False: David said the LORD had given rest to Israel on every side and subdued the land before them.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:18 confirms that the LORD gave rest on every side and subdued the land for Israel.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Chronicles 22:19: 'Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God; arise therefore, and build ye the ______ of the LORD God.'
questions.correctAnswer: sanctuary
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:19 instructs to build the sanctuary of the LORD God.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 22:15, who are among the workmen prepared to assist Solomon?
options: Hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of cunning men
questions.correctAnswer: Hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of cunning men
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:15 describes the workmen as hewers, workers of stone and timber, and skilled craftsmen.

questions.question: What did David say to Solomon to encourage him before building the house, as recorded in 1 Chronicles 22:16?
options: Arise therefore, and be doing, and the LORD be with thee
Fear not, for you are alone
questions.correctAnswer: Arise therefore, and be doing, and the LORD be with thee
questions.explanation: In 1 Chronicles 22:16, David encourages Solomon to arise and start work, assuring him of the LORD’s presence.

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 22 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 22 teach us about preparing diligently for God’s work?
options: Prepare abundantly and gather resources before starting the work
Wait for others to prepare everything
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare abundantly and gather resources before starting the work
questions.explanation: David prepared abundantly of iron, brass, cedar, and other materials for the house of the Lord before his death (1 Chronicles 22:3-5, 14-16). This shows the importance of diligent preparation in God’s work.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear and discouragement in their service. Based on 1 Chronicles 22, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Be strong and of good courage; do not be dismayed
Give up if the task is too hard
Wait for others to encourage you
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong and of good courage; do not be dismayed
questions.explanation: David encouraged Solomon to be strong and courageous, not fearing or being dismayed as he fulfilled God's commands (1 Chronicles 22:13). This teaches believers to trust God and persevere.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 22 teach about seeking God’s wisdom in leadership and responsibilities?
options: Ask the LORD for wisdom and understanding to govern well
questions.correctAnswer: Ask the LORD for wisdom and understanding to govern well
questions.explanation: David prayed that the LORD would give Solomon wisdom and understanding to keep the law and govern Israel properly (1 Chronicles 22:12). This emphasizes dependence on God’s wisdom.

questions.question: How does this passage teach us about the importance of obedience to God's laws?
options: Prosperity comes from fulfilling God's statutes and judgments
Ignoring God's laws will not affect outcomes
Only external actions matter, not obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Prosperity comes from fulfilling God's statutes and judgments
questions.explanation: David assured Solomon that he would prosper if he carefully obeyed all the statutes and judgments given by the LORD through Moses (1 Chronicles 22:13). Obedience is key to God’s blessing.

questions.question: What can we learn from David’s instruction to Solomon about trusting God’s promises in difficult times?
options: God promises rest and peace despite past struggles
questions.correctAnswer: God promises rest and peace despite past struggles
questions.explanation: God told David that Solomon, his son, would be a man of rest and would build the house, receiving peace and quietness during his reign (1 Chronicles 22:8-10). This teaches trust in God's faithfulness.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 22, how should a leader approach the task God sets before them?
options: With full commitment and reliance on God’s presence
By delegating all tasks and avoiding responsibility
By depending on human strength alone
By delaying action until perfect conditions
questions.correctAnswer: With full commitment and reliance on God’s presence
questions.explanation: David told Solomon to arise and be doing the work, assuring him the LORD would be with him (1 Chronicles 22:16). Commitment and trust in God’s presence are essential.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 22 emphasize the role of community support in God’s work?
options: David commanded princes and people to help Solomon
Leaders should work alone without help
Only priests should build the house
God’s work requires no human involvement
questions.correctAnswer: David commanded princes and people to help Solomon
questions.explanation: David instructed all the princes of Israel to support Solomon in building the house of the LORD, showing the importance of community cooperation (1 Chronicles 22:17-19).

questions.question: What attitude toward God’s provision is taught in 1 Chronicles 22?
options: Be grateful and use God’s abundant provision responsibly
questions.correctAnswer: Be grateful and use God’s abundant provision responsibly
questions.explanation: David prepared vast amounts of gold, silver, brass, iron, timber, and stone abundantly and encouraged adding to it for the house of God (1 Chronicles 22:14-15). This teaches gratitude and stewardship.

questions.question: True or False: David was allowed by God to build the house of the LORD because of his many wars and bloodshed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: God told David he would not build the house because he had shed much blood and made great wars (1 Chronicles 22:8). Instead, Solomon would build it.

questions.question: True or False: David’s charge to Solomon included the instruction to seek the LORD wholeheartedly and build the sanctuary.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: David urged Solomon and the people to set their hearts to seek the LORD and to build the sanctuary for the ark of the covenant and holy vessels (1 Chronicles 22:19).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: David said, 'Now, behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the LORD an hundred thousand talents of ____, and a thousand thousand talents of silver.'
questions.correctAnswer: gold
questions.explanation: David states explicitly that he prepared one hundred thousand talents of gold and a thousand thousand talents of silver for the house of the LORD (1 Chronicles 22:14).

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 22, how does one prosper in leadership and service to God?
options: By obeying God’s statutes and judgments carefully
questions.correctAnswer: By obeying God’s statutes and judgments carefully
questions.explanation: David told Solomon that prosperity comes from carefully fulfilling the LORD’s statutes and judgments (1 Chronicles 22:13), emphasizing obedience as key to success.

questions.question: What practical lesson about work ethic can be learned from David’s preparation for the temple?
options: Prepare thoroughly and enlist skilled workers for God’s work
Work only when motivated by others
Avoid hard work for spiritual projects
Rely on miracles instead of effort
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare thoroughly and enlist skilled workers for God’s work
questions.explanation: David gathered masons, skilled workers, and prepared materials abundantly for the temple building, showing the value of hard work and planning (1 Chronicles 22:2, 15).

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 22 encourage believers to face challenges in fulfilling God’s commands?
options: Fear not nor be dismayed; be strong and courageous
questions.correctAnswer: Fear not nor be dismayed; be strong and courageous
questions.explanation: David encouraged Solomon to be strong and not fear or be dismayed as he undertook God’s work (1 Chronicles 22:13), teaching perseverance through trials.

questions.question: What does 1 Chronicles 22 say about the role of family and parenting in spiritual legacy?
options: Parents should instruct and charge their children to serve God faithfully
Spiritual responsibility does not involve family
Children learn spirituality on their own
questions.correctAnswer: Parents should instruct and charge their children to serve God faithfully
questions.explanation: David called Solomon his son and charged him to build the house of the LORD, giving him wisdom and encouragement (1 Chronicles 22:6-7, 11-12), showing the importance of parenting in spiritual leadership.

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 22.

questions.question: What reason did the LORD give David for not building the house for His name?
options: David had shed much blood and made great wars
David was too old to build the house
questions.correctAnswer: David had shed much blood and made great wars
questions.explanation: The LORD told David that because he had shed much blood upon the earth, he would not build the house unto His name (1 Chronicles 22:8).

questions.question: Who did David say would build the house for the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: David stated that Solomon, his son, would build the house for the LORD (1 Chronicles 22:10).

questions.question: Which materials did David prepare in abundance for the construction of the house of God?
options: Iron, brass, cedar trees, stone, and gold
Gold, silver, bronze, and fine linen
questions.correctAnswer: Iron, brass, cedar trees, stone, and gold
questions.explanation: David prepared iron, brass, cedar trees from Zidonians and Tyrians, stone, and large quantities of gold and silver for the house (1 Chronicles 22:3-4,14).

questions.question: What was David’s instruction to Solomon regarding wisdom and understanding?
options: That the LORD alone give him wisdom and understanding to keep the law
To seek advice from the elders of Israel
To rely on his own judgment
To consult the priests for all decisions
questions.correctAnswer: That the LORD alone give him wisdom and understanding to keep the law
questions.explanation: David charged Solomon that only the LORD should give him wisdom and understanding to keep the law and govern Israel rightly (1 Chronicles 22:12).

questions.question: How did David describe Solomon’s future reign in terms of peace?
options: A man of rest who would bring peace and quietness to Israel
A warrior king who would continue David’s battles
A judge who would rule with strictness
A prophet who would speak to the nations
questions.correctAnswer: A man of rest who would bring peace and quietness to Israel
questions.explanation: David said Solomon would be a man of rest and that God would give peace and quietness to Israel during his days (1 Chronicles 22:9).

questions.question: What role did the Zidonians and Tyrians play in the building preparations?
options: They brought much cedar wood to David
questions.correctAnswer: They brought much cedar wood to David
questions.explanation: The Zidonians and people of Tyre brought abundant cedar wood to David for the construction (1 Chronicles 22:4).

questions.question: Which of the following best reflects the literary structure found in David’s charge to Solomon?
options: A chiasm emphasizing wisdom and courage
A parallelism contrasting war and peace
An acrostic poem praising the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: A chiasm emphasizing wisdom and courage
questions.explanation: David’s charge uses chiasm, focusing on wisdom, understanding, courage, and trust in the LORD (1 Chronicles 22:11-13).

questions.question: What did David say about the number of workmen and craftsmen available for building the house?
options: They were abundant and skilled in every kind of work
There were very few and inexperienced workers
Only priests were allowed to work
Only family members of David could build
questions.correctAnswer: They were abundant and skilled in every kind of work
questions.explanation: David noted there were many workmen, hewers, stoneworkers, timber workers, and craftsmen available for all kinds of work (1 Chronicles 22:15).

questions.question: According to the text, what was David’s emotional state during the preparations for the house?
options: In his trouble, he prepared vast resources
questions.correctAnswer: In his trouble, he prepared vast resources
questions.explanation: David said, 'in my trouble I have prepared' large amounts of gold, silver, and materials for the house (1 Chronicles 22:14).

questions.question: True or False: David commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon build the house of the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: David instructed all princes of Israel to assist Solomon in building the house (1 Chronicles 22:17).

questions.question: What did David emphasize the people should do with their heart and soul?
options: Seek the LORD your God and build the sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: Seek the LORD your God and build the sanctuary
questions.explanation: David exhorted the people to set their heart and soul to seek the LORD and to build the sanctuary (1 Chronicles 22:19).

questions.question: How does Solomon’s role as builder foreshadow messianic themes later in Scripture?
options: Solomon’s peaceful reign and building of God’s house prefigure the Messiah’s eternal kingdom
Solomon was a warrior like the Messiah
Solomon’s failure predicted the Messiah’s success
Solomon’s temple was made of gold like the heavenly Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon’s peaceful reign and building of God’s house prefigure the Messiah’s eternal kingdom
questions.explanation: Solomon is a type of Christ, the Prince of Peace, who establishes God's eternal kingdom and spiritual temple (1 Chronicles 22:9-10).

questions.question: The abundance of materials David prepared, such as gold and silver, reflects what cultural practice in the ancient Near East?
options: Kings preparing monumental temple projects as displays of piety and power
questions.correctAnswer: Kings preparing monumental temple projects as displays of piety and power
questions.explanation: David’s lavish preparations mirror Near Eastern royal practices of constructing grand temples to affirm divine favor and political authority (1 Chronicles 22:14-16).

questions.question: What is the significance of David gathering strangers (foreigners) to help build the house of God?
options: It shows the temple’s universal significance and cooperation beyond Israel
It caused conflict and division within Israel
It was forbidden by the law of Moses
Only Israelites were allowed to build the house
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the temple’s universal significance and cooperation beyond Israel
questions.explanation: David gathered strangers to assist, indicating the temple project’s broad cultural and political impact beyond Israelite boundaries (1 Chronicles 22:2).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: David said, 'Now, behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the LORD an ______ talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver.'
questions.correctAnswer: hundred thousand
questions.explanation: David prepared an hundred thousand talents of gold as stated in 1 Chronicles 22:14.

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 22 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 22 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What reason did God give David for not building the house for the LORD?
options: David had shed much blood upon the earth in God's sight
David was too old and weak
David was not chosen by God
questions.correctAnswer: David had shed much blood upon the earth in God's sight
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:8 states that God told David he could not build the temple because he had shed much blood and made great wars. This aligns with Scripture emphasizing God's holiness and the need for purity in His sanctuary (Exodus 20:5, 2 Samuel 7:12-13, Isaiah 2:2-3, Hebrews 9:11-12).

questions.question: Who was appointed to build the house of the LORD after David?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: David charged his son Solomon to build the house of the LORD, as seen in 1 Chronicles 22:6. Solomon's role as builder fulfills God's promise of establishing a peaceful reign (1 Chronicles 22:9-10), connected to messianic typology (Psalm 72, Matthew 1:6).

questions.question: According to the chapter, what is one essential characteristic Solomon must have to successfully build the house of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom and understanding
questions.explanation: David prays that the LORD would give Solomon wisdom and understanding to govern Israel and build the temple (1 Chronicles 22:12). This echoes God's promise to give wisdom to Solomon in 1 Kings 3:9-12 and reflects the biblical theme that divine wisdom is essential for righteous leadership (Proverbs 2:6, James 1:5).

questions.question: What materials did David prepare in abundance for the temple's construction?
options: Iron, brass, cedar trees, gold, and silver
questions.correctAnswer: Iron, brass, cedar trees, gold, and silver
questions.explanation: David prepared iron for nails, brass in abundance, cedar from Tyre, and large quantities of gold and silver (1 Chronicles 22:3-4, 14). This preparation underscores the importance of costly and durable materials for the house of God, reflecting holiness and glory (Exodus 25:3-7, 1 Kings 6:15-22).

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 22 describe the nature of Solomon’s reign in relation to peace?
options: A man of rest and peace, with quietness to Israel
A warrior king who expands the kingdom by force
A ruler who constantly faces rebellion
An isolated leader with little influence
questions.correctAnswer: A man of rest and peace, with quietness to Israel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:9 describes Solomon as a man of rest to whom God will give peace and quietness in his days. This reflects the biblical ideal of messianic peace (Isaiah 9:6-7, Psalm 72:7, Micah 5:5, John 14:27).

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'house of the LORD God of Israel' as used in this chapter?
options: It emphasizes God's covenant presence with Israel
It refers to a palace for the king
It is a metaphor for the nation of Israel
It means the temple is a public meeting hall
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes God's covenant presence with Israel
questions.explanation: The 'house of the LORD God of Israel' (1 Chronicles 22:6) denotes the temple as the dwelling place of God among His covenant people, emphasizing divine presence and worship (Exodus 25:8, 1 Kings 8:10-13, Psalm 132:13-14, John 2:19-21).

questions.question: According to David's charge, what attitude should Solomon have in undertaking the building of the temple?
options: Be strong, of good courage, and not dismayed
Be cautious and delay the work
Seek the people's approval before building
questions.correctAnswer: Be strong, of good courage, and not dismayed
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:13 exhorts Solomon to be strong and courageous, to fear not or be dismayed, reflecting the biblical theme of God strengthening His servants for His purposes (Joshua 1:9, Deuteronomy 31:6, Psalm 27:14, Isaiah 41:10).

questions.question: What role did foreign workers and materials play in the preparation for the temple?
options: Zidonians and Tyrians brought cedar wood and skilled craftsmen were gathered
Only Israelites were allowed to work and bring materials
Foreign materials were rejected as unclean
questions.correctAnswer: Zidonians and Tyrians brought cedar wood and skilled craftsmen were gathered
questions.explanation: David received cedar wood from Zidonians and Tyrians and gathered skilled workers (1 Chronicles 22:4, 15). This openness to foreign materials and artisans reflects biblical instances of God's people using Gentile resources for His purposes (1 Kings 5:1-18, Ezra 3:7, Acts 10:34-35).

questions.question: What does David’s abundant preparation before his death suggest about God's providence and human responsibility?
options: God provides resources and humans must prepare diligently
God does everything without human effort
Preparation is unnecessary if God wills
Only kings are responsible for spiritual work
questions.correctAnswer: God provides resources and humans must prepare diligently
questions.explanation: David's preparation of gold, silver, brass, iron, timber, and stone (1 Chronicles 22:14) shows human responsibility to use God-given resources in obedience, consistent with biblical teaching on stewardship (Proverbs 21:20, Luke 14:28, 1 Corinthians 3:9, Colossians 3:23).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the ark of the covenant in the context of building the temple?
options: It represents God's presence and covenant with Israel
It is merely a decorative object
It is a symbol of the king's authority only
questions.correctAnswer: It represents God's presence and covenant with Israel
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:19 commands the building of the sanctuary to bring in the ark and holy vessels, emphasizing the ark as God's covenant presence (Exodus 25:22, Deuteronomy 10:1-5, Hebrews 9:4, Revelation 11:19).

questions.question: Which divine attribute is most clearly displayed in God’s promise to establish Solomon’s throne forever?
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness and sovereignty
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:10 shows God's promise to establish Solomon’s throne forever, revealing His faithfulness to His covenant and sovereign control over history, consistent with God's unchanging nature (Psalm 89:34-37, Isaiah 9:7, 2 Samuel 7:16, Hebrews 13:8).

questions.question: What does David’s exhortation to the princes of Israel reveal about the community's role in temple building?
options: The community is called to actively support and seek God
Only the king and priests should be involved
Building the temple is a solitary task
questions.correctAnswer: The community is called to actively support and seek God
questions.explanation: David commands the princes to help Solomon and to set their hearts and souls to seek the LORD (1 Chronicles 22:17, 19). This shows corporate responsibility in worship and obedience (Exodus 19:5-6, Psalm 133:1, Hebrews 10:24-25, 1 Corinthians 12:12-27).

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 22 portray the relationship between divine command and human obedience in temple construction?
options: God commands, and humans must respond with dedicated obedience
Humans build independently without divine guidance
Divine command is irrelevant to human action
Humans obey only after the temple is complete
questions.correctAnswer: God commands, and humans must respond with dedicated obedience
questions.explanation: David’s charge to Solomon to build the temple as God commanded (1 Chronicles 22:11,19) shows the harmony of divine sovereignty and human obedience, a biblical principle (Deuteronomy 28:1, Joshua 1:7-8, John 14:15, Romans 12:1).

questions.question: What does the abundance of materials and skilled workmen indicate about worship and service to God?
options: Worship requires excellence and costly dedication
Worship is casual and requires no preparation
God prefers worship without any material resources
questions.correctAnswer: Worship requires excellence and costly dedication
questions.explanation: David’s preparation of vast amounts of gold, silver, brass, iron, timber, and skilled craftsmen (1 Chronicles 22:14-15, 16) reflects biblical teaching that worship should be offered with the best resources and dedication (Exodus 35:21-29, 1 Chronicles 29:1-5, 2 Chronicles 7:1-3, Hebrews 12:28).

questions.question: What is the ultimate purpose of building the house of the LORD according to this chapter?
options: To bring the ark of the covenant and the holy vessels into a sanctuary for God’s name
To create a political capital for Israel
To serve as a fortress against enemies
To display David’s wealth and power
questions.correctAnswer: To bring the ark of the covenant and the holy vessels into a sanctuary for God’s name
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 22:19 explains the goal as building the sanctuary to bring the ark and holy vessels, emphasizing God's presence and covenant as central (Exodus 25:10-22, 1 Kings 8:1-11, Hebrews 9:1-5, Revelation 11:19).
